column4: my GRUB boot menu is showing I have like 3 versions of ubuntu on my harddrive, i'm using fiesty now, how do I get rid of the old ones. i think they're taking up room on my HD
but won't they still be taking up space on my hD
you can use the package manager to remove em or just delete em from /boot
what do I look for in synaptic
search for linux-image   itll be selected if installed and just uncheck whichever you want to remove
so I can uninstall all the kernals except the latest one
mark for removal or mark for complete removal
ive not used synaptic.. id guess 'complete removal' is maybe --purge? but im not sure
should i just do it in cli then?
thats what id do. just dpkg -l | grep linux-image  then sudo apt-get remove the ones you dont want in that list
ah here's the difference. complete removal removes all dependancies
remove completely purges and then removes all the dependancies
